page.title: 04The Miners Strike
page.content:
I was at school the day the strike started. When I came home at lunch-time and saw my mother sitting in the chair with her head in her hands. I asked her what was wrong. She told me dad had been sent home from work. The union had called a strike.
At first we thought it would be only for a little while but it went on and on. Money was very short and the bills kept coming in. Mum and dad used their holiday money to buy new school clothes for me. I didn't want them to use it but they insisted. Sometimes I didn't feel well as I thought the strike was never going to end. Christmas was a sad time for mum and dad because they couldn't give us the gifts they wanted to give us. My two older brothers helped out when they could but I felt so helpless (cont.)
